entry.def: The most general word for to give is probably yǔ 與 (ant. qǔ 取 "take away from").
The most general word for to give is probably yǔ 與 (ant. qǔ 取 "take away from").

entry.def: Yǔ 與 adds to the notion of accompaniment that of tactical association, the siding with someone, and occasionally the latter nuance is stronger than the meaning "to accompany" so that the word comes to mean purely "to side with". >>HORIZONTAL or DESCENDING

entry.def: Yù 與 "side with" focusses on the social aspect of assent which involves moral and sometimes even practical support for the person with whom one agrees. [PRACTICAL], [SPECIALISED]

entry.def: The current general word for cooperation is yǔ 與 (ant. jué 絕 "cut off relations with").

entry.def: Between NPs ruò 若 and yǔ 與 are very occasionally used to mean "or".

sense.def: or (between verbals：claimed disjunctions!)
or (between nominals)

entry.def: Yǔ 與 "and" is the general all-purpose coordinating particle between NPs which, in ZUO, is equally common in subject and object position, and which coordinates both with concrete and abstract items, often topics, sometimes even pivots. [NOMINAL-SCOPE]

sense.def: and also, and in addition
and 吾與汝俱不如也
and 父與夫孰親
as well as, and in addition
and 非我與吾子之罪
and (conjoining objects) 。
and 衛侯逐公叔戍與其黨，
and (conjoining abstract N) 禮與信
and (conjoining pivots) 使公子燮與子儀守
like 而: V2 and V1
